name: PAS_builder
description: PAS model from CATIE. The id is an UUID identifying the model. Can be generated by the OT when publishing the model

connectors.description: this connector provides info of the necessary parameters to be able to request the IH via HTTP

input.name: vesselCalls_requests
input.description: List of vessels stopover in terminal that will require to be handled. Each one is converter to one or more handlings (e.g. if unloading then loading): Vessel-calls (1 --> N) Hadlings

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

input.name: contentTypes_collection
input.description: Reference list of content of vessels to handle. Used for supply-chain allocation: Content-type (1 -(N)-> 1) Supply-chain

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

input.name: supplychains_collection
input.description: List of available supply-chains (sequence of operations) for handling a vessel's content. Used for resources allocation: Supply-chain (1 --> N) Resources

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

input.name: resources_collection
input.description: List of available resources (machines, areas etc) for supply-chain's operations. Used for use calculation (scheduling and energy consumption) : Resources (1 --> N) Uses

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

input.name: timetables_collection
input.description: List of available timetables (working days & hours) for resources. Used for use calculation (scheduling and energy consumption) : Timetable (1 --> N) Resources

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

input.name: vesselPriority
input.description: Hierarchical sequence of vessel-call attributs defining it's priority. Used to resolve resources allocation priority (in case of competition for access to a resource in the same time)

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id of the datasource in the IH repo

output.name: PAS-builder_PAS
output.description: Port's Activities Scenario: for each vessel-call, a list of activities. For each of thoses activities, a scheduling and a list of used resources. For each of thoses resources, a list of energy consumptions.

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id to store the result in the IH repo

output.name: PAS-builder_logs
output.description: PAS model's internal logs. Useful to enlighten provided PAS and spot issues (discarded handlings etc)

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id to store the result in the IH repo

output.name: PAS-builder_settings
output.description: Settings used by the PAS model for producing the given PAS (enabled coercitive filter etc)

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id to store the result in the IH repo

output.name: PAS-builder_inputs
output.description: Vessel-calls and port's parameters used by the PAS model for producing the given PAS

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id to store the result in the IH repo

logging.name: PAS-builder_Platform-logging
logging.description: activity logging for the energy-consumption model. id_execution is given by the OT at invocation time

metadata:.usage: optional, future use or extra logic for each model, no specific structure

options.name: sourceId
options.description: id to store the log activity in the IH repo
